means: 转化或者被转化为焦炭

sentence.Network_en: "Steve, what do you want?" — "Coke, Pepsi, it doesn't matter."
sentence.Network_cn: “史蒂夫，你要喝点什么？”——“可口可乐，百事，随便啦。”

sentence.Network_en: He was still hanging around, swigging the Coke out of the can.
sentence.Network_cn: 他还在闲逛，拿着一罐可乐大口大口地喝着。

sentence.Network_en: The children kept dripping Coke on the carpets.
sentence.Network_cn: 孩子们老往地毯上滴可乐。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'charcoal'): of unknown origin. The current sense dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.def: Coke is a solid black substance that is produced from coal and is burned as a fuel.
Coke is the same as cocaine .

means.word_mean: 1. carbon fuel produced by distillation of coal

sentences.en: Coke is used as fuel and in making steel.
sentences.cn: 焦炭被用作燃料和制造钢铁。

sentences.en: Coke burns with oxygen to give carbon dioxide.
sentences.cn: 焦碳用氧气燃烧，产生二氧化碳。

sentences.en: Coke is an economical fuel but it leaves a lot of ash.
sentences.cn: 焦炭是一种很经济的燃料,可是燃烧后剩下很多灰。
